      • registerCustomClue

        com.electro2560.dev.cluescrolls.api.CustomClue registerCustomClue(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin,
                                                                  java.lang.String clueName,
                                                                  com.electro2560.dev.cluescrolls.api.ClueConfigData... clueConfigData)
        To create a custom clue, you must pass your plugin, the name of the clue and an array of ClueConfigData. The name of your custom clue will be yourPlugin_clueName The ClueConfigData represents the different types of data you may want a user to be able to specify in their config under the data section of the clue. To call to update any clues for a player, call CustomClue.handle(Player, ClueDataPair...) passing in the name of the player to update and an array of ClueDataPairs. ClueDataPair is similar to ClueConfigData. You create ClueDataPairs to specify the details of what action the user has completed that you'd like to update clues for. The ClueDataPair.key is the name of the data in the config for the clue, and is also the key you specified when setting up the ClueConfigData for this custom clue. If there is data you wish to ignore entirely, pass a ClueDataPair with it's ClueDataPair.value null.
        Parameters:
        plugin -
        clueName -
        clueConfigData -
